ble_client.docs:
The `ble_client` component is a switch platform that is used to enable and disable a `ble_client`. This has several uses, such as minimizing battery usage or for allowing other clients (Eg phone apps) to connect to the device.

*See also: [BLE Client Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/ble_client.html#ble-client-switch)*

copy.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The switch that should be mirrored.

*See also: [Copy Switch](https://esphome.io/components/copy.html#copy-switch)*

dfrobot_sen0395.docs:
[Switch components](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#config-switch) are used to enable/disable various module features/functions.

*See also: [dfrobot_sen0395 Switch](https://esphome.io/components/dfrobot_sen0395.html#switch)*

factory_reset.docs:
The `factory_reset` switch allows you to remotely invalidate (reset) all ESPHome [preferences](https://esphome.io/components/esphome.html#preferences-flash-write-interval) stored in flash memory and reboot your node. After reboot all states, parameters and variables will be reinitialized with their default values. This is useful:

*See also: [Factory Reset Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/factory_reset.html#factory-reset-switch)*

gpio.docs:
The `gpio` switch platform allows you to use any pin on your node as a switch. You can for example hook up a relay to a GPIO pin and use it through this platform.

*See also: [GPIO Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/gpio.html#gpio-switch)*

haier.docs:
Additional switches to support additional features for Haier AC.

*See also: [Haier Climate Switches](https://esphome.io/components/switch/haier.html#haier-climate-switches)*

hbridge.docs:
The `hbridge` switch platform allows you to drive an *h-bridge* controlled latching relay.

*See also: [H-bridge Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/hbridge.html#h-bridge-switch)*

homeassistant.docs:
The `homeassistant` Switch platform allows you to create Switch that **import** states and allow **control** via your Home Assistant instance using the [native API](https://esphome.io/components/api.html).

*See also: [Home Assistant Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/homeassistant.html#home-assistant-switch)*

ld2410.docs:
The `ld2410` switch allows you to control your [LD2410 Sensor.

*See also: [ld2410 Switch](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ld2410.html#switch)*

ld2450.docs:
The `ld2450` switch allows you to control your [LD2450 Sensor `Bluetooth` and `Multi/Single Target Tracking`.

*See also: [ld2450 Switch](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ld2450.html#switch)*

lvgl.docs:
The `lvgl` switch platform creates a switch from an LVGL widget and requires [LVGL](https://esphome.io/components/lvgl/index.html) to be configured.

*See also: [LVGL Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/lvgl.html#lvgl-switch)*

modbus_controller.docs:
The `modbus_controller` switch platform creates a switch from a modbus_controller component and requires [Modbus Controller](https://esphome.io/components/modbus_controller.html) to be configured.

*See also: [Modbus Controller Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/modbus_controller.html#modbus-controller-switch)*

nextion.docs:
The `nextion` switch platform supports the many switched components in the Nextion as well as integer variables. It can be a component or variable in the Nextion display. It is best to set the components vscope to global in the Nextion Editor. This way the component will be available if the page is shown or not.

*See also: [Nextion Switch Component](https://esphome.io/components/switch/nextion.html#nextion-switch-component)*

opentherm.docs:
Switches are available to allow manual toggling of any of the following seven status codes:

*See also: [opentherm Switch](https://esphome.io/components/opentherm.html#switch)*

output.docs:
The `output` switch platform allows you to use any output component as a switch.

*See also: [Generic Output Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/output.html#generic-output-switch)*

pipsolar.docs:
Not all possible switches are exposed as they lead to the possibility to make serious damage. They should only be set at the physical device itself.

*See also: [pipsolar Switch](https://esphome.io/components/pipsolar.html#switch)*

restart.docs:
The `restart` switch platform allows you to restart your node remotely through Home Assistant.

*See also: [Restart Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/restart.html#restart-switch)*

safe_mode.docs:
The `safe_mode` switch allows you to remotely reboot your node into [Safe Mode](https://esphome.io/components/safe_mode.html). This is useful in certain situations where a misbehaving component, or low memory state is preventing Over-The-Air updates from completing successfully.

*See also: [Safe Mode Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/safe_mode.html#safe-mode-switch)*

seeed_mr24hpc1.docs:
The `seeed_mr24hpc1` switch allows you to control your device.

*See also: [seeed_mr24hpc1 Switch](https://esphome.io/components/seeed_mr24hpc1.html#switch)*

shutdown.docs:
The `shutdown` switch platform allows you to shutdown your node remotely through Home Assistant. It does this by putting the node into deep sleep mode with no wakeup source selected. After enabling, the only way to startup the ESP again is by pressing the reset button or restarting the power supply.

*See also: [Shutdown Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/shutdown.html#shutdown-switch)*

template.docs:
The `template` switch platform allows you to create simple switches out of just actions and an optional value lambda. Once defined, it will automatically appear in Home Assistant as a switch and can be controlled through the frontend.

*See also: [Template Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/template.html#template-switch)*

tuya.docs:
The `tuya` switch platform creates a sensor from a tuya serial component and requires [Tuya MCU](https://esphome.io/components/tuya.html) to be configured.

*See also: [Tuya Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/tuya.html#tuya-switch)*

uart.docs:
The `uart` switch platform allows you to send a pre-defined sequence of bytes on a [UART bus](https://esphome.io/components/uart.html) when triggered.

*See also: [UART Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/uart.html#uart-switch)*

inverted.docs:
**boolean**: Whether to invert the binary state, i.e. report ON states as OFF and vice versa. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [Switch Component](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#base-switch-configuration)*

on_turn_on.docs:
**[Action](https://esphome.io/automations/actions.html#config-action)**: An automation to perform when the switch is turned on. See [switch.on_turn_on / switch.on_turn_off Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#switch-on-turn-on-off-trigger).

*See also: [Switch Component](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#base-switch-configuration)*

on_turn_off.docs:
**[Action](https://esphome.io/automations/actions.html#config-action)**: An automation to perform when the switch is turned off. See [switch.on_turn_on / switch.on_turn_off Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#switch-on-turn-on-off-trigger).

*See also: [Switch Component](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#base-switch-configuration)*

device_class.docs:
**string**: The device class for the switch. See [https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/switch/#device-class](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/switch/#device-class) for a list of available options.

*See also: [Switch Component](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#base-switch-configuration)*

RESTORE_DEFAULT_OFF.docs: Attempt to restore state and default to OFF if not possible to restore.

RESTORE_DEFAULT_ON.docs: Attempt to restore state and default to ON.

ALWAYS_ON.docs: Always initialize the switch as ON on bootup.

RESTORE_INVERTED_DEFAULT_OFF.docs: Attempt to restore state inverted from the previous state and default to OFF.

RESTORE_INVERTED_DEFAULT_ON.docs: Attempt to restore state inverted from the previous state and default to ON.

DISABLED.docs: Does nothing and leaves it up to the downstream platform component to decide. For example, the component could read hardware and determine the state, or have a specific configuration option to regulate initial state.

restore_mode.docs:
Control how the switch attempts to restore state on bootup. **NOTE** : Not all components consider **restore_mode**. Check the documentation of the specific component to understand how this feature works for a particular component or device. For restoring on ESP8266s, also see `restore_from_flash` in the [esp8266 section](https://esphome.io/components/esp8266.html).
  * `RESTORE_DEFAULT_OFF` - Attempt to restore state and default to OFF if not possible to restore.
  
  * `RESTORE_DEFAULT_ON` - Attempt to restore state and default to ON.
  
  * `RESTORE_INVERTED_DEFAULT_OFF` - Attempt to restore state inverted from the previous state and default to OFF.
  
  * `RESTORE_INVERTED_DEFAULT_ON` - Attempt to restore state inverted from the previous state and default to ON.
  
  * `ALWAYS_OFF` (Default) - Always initialize the switch as OFF on bootup.
  
  * `ALWAYS_ON` - Always initialize the switch as ON on bootup.
  
  * `DISABLED` - Does nothing and leaves it up to the downstream platform component to decide. For example, the component could read hardware and determine the state, or have a specific configuration option to regulate initial state.
  
  Unless a specific platform defines another default value, the default is `ALWAYS_OFF`.

*See also: [Switch Component](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#base-switch-configuration)*

id.docs:
**string**: Manually specify the ID for code generation. At least one of **id** and **name** must be specified.

*See also: [Switch Component](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#base-switch-configuration)*

turn_on.docs:
This action turns a switch with the given ID on when executed.

*See also: [`switch.turn_on` Action](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#switch-turn-on-action)*

turn_off.docs:
This action turns a switch with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [`switch.turn_off` Action](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#switch-turn-off-action)*

toggle.docs:
This action toggles a switch with the given ID when executed.

*See also: [`switch.toggle` Action](https://esphome.io/components/switch/index.html#switch-toggle-action)*

source_id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The source switch to observe.

*See also: [Switch Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/switch.html#configuration-variables)*
